title: Buffs in 6.15
body:
Riot. I am just surprised. Seriously.

Do you want to force us to permaban vayne? Who is actually on border of being broken? Giving them 25 AA range and crits on Q, srsly...

replies.body:
Here's what's in 6.15:

* Tumble - Changed so that the basic attack and bonus damage can no longer crit separately. 

Previously each used a different calculation, now both use the same one. Average damage should be the same, should be clearer exactly what happened though. 

* Q now works on towers, consuming the buff and dealing bonus damage.

We feel Vayne's a little on the weak side, even for experienced Vayne players (going to have to disagree with you on 'border of being broken'). We wanted to add a bit of power to her as a result, but didn't want to give her more raw damage against enemy champs. A bit of tower killing power by contrast seemed an appropriate choice.

where are the draven buffs fam

Q should work on towers, dealing bonus damage and making the axes bounce

;)
... 2 patches later.  "Well Draven just 2-shot the inhib tower..."
Isn't it better for Draven players that the axes don't bounce off towers? It auto-resets the Q buff.
i would rather they bounce of towers because then i can stack my passive on towers by catching axes and then it would make sense for the damage to be dealt to the tower if the axes bounce

I'm happy boosted animal ideas never go trough. Such as this one. Please also make varus Q do dmg to turrets as well as sivir Q also twitch should be able to use his E on turrets. Lets just make every adc a tristana. {{item:3902}}

?? Draven q is an auto attack modifier, not a skillshot. How come talon and wukong q affect towers? Twisted fate w?

EU adc main stuck in gold 5 smh
To be honest I don't know why the crit calculation wasn't this way in the first place
I suspect just oversight, given the inconsistency with other abilities that add damage that can crit.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=4ecIqkus,comment-id=000e00120000,timestamp=2016-07-23T00:53:47.313+0000)
>
> I suspect just oversight, given the inconsistency with other abilities that add damage that can crit.

Why not just completely rework her? I don't think you can ever balance vayne with numbers in her current state. Sth like "Does bonus true dmg based on crit" seems like a decent option, rather than having her do %hp true dmg.

There's a reason why vayne is build the way she is, she is riots blessed "assassin adc", there needs to be a champion that can kite like hell and chase down opponents with ease. Someway to 100-0 someone as an adc. If you think of vayne being "broken" I'd have to say differently. There is a very easy way of beating a vayne. It's called distance. Vayne only has a certain bubble of reach, if she can't reach you she might as well be a worm sqirming in front of a blue jay, you see my point here? Play around her bubble of auto attacks and rolling and she's nothing. Many people have trouble learning the terms of "Dance around the bubble" so they say she's broken without trying to counter her in anyway shape or form. Take varus for example, absolute counter. Has decent range and his ult counters hers. There's no point of being invisible if you can't dodge.

Someway to 100-0 someone as an adc. If you think of vayne being "broken" I'd have to say differently. There is a very easy way of beating a vayne. It's called distance. Vayne only has a certain bubble of reach, if she can't reach you she might as well be a worm sqirming in front of a blue jay, you see my point here? Play around her bubble of auto attacks and rolling and she's nothing. Many people have trouble learning the terms of "Dance around the bubble" so they say she's broken without trying to counter her in anyway shape or form. Take varus for example, absolute counter. Has decent range and his ult counters hers. There's no point of being invisible if you can't dodge.

Bubbles and worms and blue jays?  Sounds like you are ready to teach common core!
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

I don't think she'll get reworked anytime soon. Champions like her, Riven, Zed, Yasuo etc. have got a high skillcap and almost are never a problem of being super op (since they need tons of practice and they should be rewarded for that, so you can't say they are too strong). Also they feel like iconic characters and there are many champions that truly need a rework before these guys.

Um did you not see what Riot did to Azir. They nerfed him into the ground even though he is one of the hardest champions in the game. I'm level 7 100k mastery points Azir and he is dead now. RIP AZIR.
cause a noob azir couldn't press EWQRERQWEWQRFWQEWQRFQWEQWe and get a penta by pure luck :D now he actually requires skill :O maybe get to 1M mastery and talk about a champ :D
Welcome to the Kalista player club

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=4ecIqkus,comment-id=000e00120000,timestamp=2016-07-23T00:53:47.313+0000)
>
> I suspect just oversight, given the inconsistency with other abilities that add damage that can crit.

What is weird is that even though you say she's apparently weak, she never feels like a weak opponent. Mid and late game, it feels like she melts you in a few autos no matter what you build.
That's the point of her design

> [{quoted}](name=FeelsWindMan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=4ecIqkus,comment-id=000e0012000000020000,timestamp=2016-08-01T03:14:14.810+0000)
>
> That's the point of her design

Just because that is the point of a design doesn't make that design good.
Perfect design for what she was made to do.

Why does her Q not state that it can crit in the tooltip? I play this game for 7 years now and didn't know this till the PBE notes, since no other empowered-AA scales with crit, it's always just the AA that crits and then the empowered damaged added to the crit.
And all other skills that interact with crit in any way state so in their tooltips(though not specifically **how **they interact, certainly a huge lack of clearity here).

And I'd have to disagree with you. Vayne's kit is very balanced right now and she has clear points of power. What makes "weak"  Vayne in comparison to the STRONG ADC's right now is the itemization. I'd honestly have to say that from the time that the ADC "rework" started up until now you've really neglected auto attack focused AD's. Caitlyn has only been able to be relevant due to her range and the fact that her W is so good to play around. Aside from that most Auto attack reliant champs have been nerfed or fallen to the way side due to buffs in items that benefit caster type ADC's for what seems to be a majority of the ADC changes this season. You slightly reduced the cost of Cutlass but Botrk is still  a very weak first item compared to Essecne reaver or Yomous. Caster ADC's have answers for both tanks and squishies early -mid game, a majority of auto attack reliant AD's do not. Perhaps Auto attack ADC's need a new first item, has this ever been considered at all this season?
I only read half of it but you CLEARLY missed the static shiv rfc meta right there after the marksman update.

I didn't miss it, I was there and experienced it. It was a mistake and they reverted it. Bbut perhaps if you read the rest of my post rather than assume I want auto attack reliant ADCs to have a borken combination of items you'll understand. The interaction between {{item:3087}}  and {{item:3094}}  was a very specific issue that was handled. Have you missed the several patches that Lucian was way too relevant due to {{item:3508}} , {{item:3142}}  and {{item:3071}}  being such efficient items, in both build path and completion. To this day these items and build paths keep said champions powerful. Currently all the best ADC's right now are have damage and relevance mostly due to the efficiency of these items. {{champion:202}} , {{champion:15}}  and {{champion:22}}  all heavily prioiritize Essence/Yomous. They give them a lot of power early game.

 {{champion:67}}  has a naturally "weak" early game whenever the ADC's who are strong in the meta are basically given tons of raw stats/damage, which is exactly what these items do. Is {{champion:222}} , {{champion:51}} , {{champion:18}} , or {{champion:429}}  an issue ever early game right now? No reason being they dont hit big points of power until 2-3 items and even when they are hitting these items they are matched and or outclassed by the ADC's mentioned before, who either move on to crit items or more Armor pen. {{champion:96}}  is literately the only Auto attack focused ADC (I dont not consider Ashe a true Auto attack reliant ADC due to Her Q,W, R spells which are powerful spells that are frequently used) whose item path matches or exceeds the damage output of these carries. 

Such that it reaches a point where they are truly relevant and comparable in terms of damage and influence. {{item:3124}} +{{item:3085}}  is pretty damn deadly and with his attack speed steroid he's a monster  in this regard. Even so considering Kog maw, the items needed to build into his core two arent nearly as efficient or effective in lane versus say an Ashe or Jhin you can build {{item:1038}} , {{item:3134}} , {{item:3133}} ; and get CDR and Armor Pen, both of which are highly potent and relevant in the laning phase. Essence Reaver even gives crit, so theres quite literately just a few overtuned items for caster/hybrid ADC's that dont exist for heavily auto attack reliant ADC's. Attack speed isnt as valuable early on as CDR/Armor pen+ tons of Raw AD. Where are the component attack speed items that give Auto attack reliant ADC's 30+ AD?

How about considerable amounts of Life steal, Raw AD AND attack speed. {{item:3144}}  and {{item:1043}} pale so much in comparison to the other components the really strong ADC's build now, not to mention Cutlass is still way too pricy for what it gives. {{item:1053}} is a much better buy because at least you get good life steal, SOME AD and have the option to buy a {{item:1042}}  for some attack speed. But does 15 AD, 10% life steal and 10-15% attack speed really stack up to 40 AD? How about 25 AD+ 10 Armor Pen in the cost of one item rather than two? Whats supplementing Auto attack reliant ADC's so they can actually fight back against some of these items that really give big spikes to these caster type ADC's? 

Honestly if there were a legitimate first item you could rush that was a good alternative to {{item:3153}}, a considerable decrease in price for some of the more auto attack focused components or better yet just straight nerfs to alot of the components currently present in {{item:3508}}  {{item:3142}} , the whole "vayne looks weak currently" would probably fade. HEr level 6 is a pretty big spike that allows her to outplay almost any ADC currently, with less oppressive statistical power in the form of REALLY stacked components being given to caster ADC's she would become a legitimate skill matchup/counter {{champion:15}} , to any ADC out there currently. Personally I think nerfing these caster AD components is the way to go.

I think you've neglected the fact that the real reason these "caster adcs" are so popular right now is because the Armor Pen. builds SPIKE way earlier. An ADC like Caitlyn or Jinx doesn't spike until after they build their 2nd Zeal item. You also forget that these items are just built by ADCs. So far, aside from Runaan's Hurricane, all of the items you have listed are very realistic options for other types of characters. Buffing/nerfing these items would wreak havoc in the rest of the meta game. Trust me, ADCs are in a completely fine spot right now. I think you also seem to forget that Kalista, Tristana, and Jinx are weak because they got nerfed A LOT.

I like the change on the tower. I hated how on hit effects dont work on tower (like jax w). you're hitting the tower , on hit skills should work (darius w, jax w, vayne q etc). Nasus q is a good example of what works
They do have a sort of "premise" on that subject, instead of on hit, on attack works, like xin W or mf P. Same reason on why GP P doesn't work on his Q, it's on attack (and they say it doesnt :^))

I don't really think vayne needs buffs, we are in a meta where mid game is important and vayne is supposed to be a late game Ad carry, of course she is going to be weak it's to be expected but that doesn't mean you should buff one of the best late game AD carry's mid game too isn't really the best course of action.

Also vayne isn't even that weak compared to other ADC's, a 48% winrate with a pick rate of 20% isn't too shabby especially when the champion is hard to play( just look at lee sin)

Maybe i'm just biased but i find vayne incredibly frustrating with steath every couple seconds and doing % hp true damage and buffing her is something i honestly just don't want to see especially with season 5 being vayne every other game.

Hey, a pretty long time vayne player here (since late season 2). I'm only d4 on EUNE, that's about equivalent to p1 EUW, but I think I've spent enough time playing this game (probably above 5000 hours and above 2000 vayne games) and gathered enough knowledge about the game to have something interesting to bring to the table. I have an idea for a moderate buff to vayne that would also bring something cool to her gameplay:
Activating R without Q available is very awkward on an otherwise very smooth champion, RQ is the standard way to engage fights as vayne.

**Make R activation reset Q's cooldown.** This gets rid of the aforementioned situation, allows a new, interesting combo of QRQ double tumble, doesn't increase vayne's damage by much (doesn't at all in the QRQ combo because the first Q's auto isn't used) and at the same time increases vayne's slipperiness - something she's known for and something you could play with before you resort to giving her some raw power for fighting champions, as you yourself stated in your post.

I assume the change to how Q crits is to prevent situations like base autoattack not critting but bonus damage critting, resulting in a weird small crit _and_ base autoattack critting but bonus damage not critting resulting in a bigger crit but still not the _full_ crit (which happened when both the base auto and Q bonus damage critted)? While personally I prefer smoother damage (more separate instances of crit RNG smooth out the results) I can see where you're coming from with this change.

Q working on turrets would be a nice change, doesn't increase vayne's damage to turrets by much ans gets rid of another awkward situation - Q not going on cooldown despite autoattacking structures. We now live in an age of things like ashe Q, trist E and jhin's passive crit working on turrets, making vayne Q work on turrets is the least you can do to help her close the gap a little in this turret pushing power creep. Just be careful to not mess something up to the point where her Q will crit on turrets or something. Also I am curious about how the interaction with an inhibitor would be like - as far as I remember some (if not all) autoattack modifiers that work on turrets don't work on inhibitors/nexus. It would feel a bit inconsistent if vayne Q was going on cooldown after autoattacking a turret but not after autoattacking an inhibitor. A way to get around this would be to simply make Q go on cooldown when autoattacking an inhibitor but not apply the bonus damage.
Potential for _kind of_ abuse with trinity force still exists and you should probably keep an eye out for thisif you implement that change - but then again vayne being rewarded with better turret pushing for building trinity force and getting closer at it to other ADCs which don't even need any specific items to have the turret pushing they have - seems fair to me.

Anyway I am curious about what you'd have to say about my "R resets Q" idea. It was probably suggested before. Maybe it already is in your notebook of "ideas for possible buffs and reworks of champion X". I would like to know why it's a bad or good idea, why wasn't it implemented if it was brought up before, what's the chance of it being implemented in the future etc.
In any case it's nice to see that you are aware that vayne is "on the weaker side" and actively looking for a way to fix that instead of listening to the cries of low elo players stomped by smurfs.
Regards, Firestorm.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=4ecIqkus,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2016-07-22T17:52:08.851+0000)
>
> Here's what's in 6.15:
> 
> * Tumble - Changed so that the basic attack and bonus damage can no longer crit separately. 
> 
> Previously each used a different calculation, now both use the same one. Average damage should be the same, should be clearer exactly what happened though. 
> 
> * Q now works on towers, consuming the buff and dealing bonus damage.
> 
> We feel Vayne's a little on the weak side, even for experienced Vayne players (going to have to disagree with you on 'border of being broken'). We wanted to add a bit of power to her as a result, but didn't want to give her more raw damage against enemy champs. A bit of tower killing power by contrast seemed an appropriate choice.

Lmao, can we expect some Twisted Fate love like ever? maybe a bit more range on Autos/W. A bit faster Q proj. speed? Hell maybe a Q active that helps him not suck so much against every one that has a gap closer. The problem with TF is his defense is really bad for any immobile mage, it often takes 1.5 to 2 seconds to select gold card and you often use it offensively leaving you open if you don't have enough damage to kill the person. It is mostly because people can't land a Q without the assistance of Stun. I would really like if TF had the Grounded mechanic Cass had. It wouldn't be broken but would make him a bit more safe.

Won't happen anytime soon. Good tf players can carry games pretty well rn but tf is a hard champion so there aren't alot of them. But if they give him a significant buff then he would dominate pro play until they hit him with a nerf.
Well aside form Spam-Bot below me, I happen to agree. Vayne is pretty weak, even the 2nd best Vayne in NA thinks Vayne is weak.

Everyone plat and above can agree vayne is weak.
Sneaky and Gosu have called Vayne a shitty-ass champion many times.
The 25 range is likely to be pulled, and Q could already crit. Is just now it only checks for crit once, as opposed to separately for the AA and Q damage.
if they pull the 25 range then itll be a nerf overall.  Is vayne really boarderline OP?
Given that her kit basically translates to "no defense you build matters"

Firstly, frozen heart and randuins both do provide defense against her. Also, looking at her damage composition on [champion.gg](http://champion.gg/champion/Vayne) she still does a lot of physical damage. Couple that with a rough early game, and I wouldn't say she's op.

It's more the relation between how much true damage she does compared to just about everyone else. Consider Vel'Koz's page, a champion who has a lot of true damage in his kit, and you'll see that Vayne's true damage portion is almost as large.
So then why is vayne broken for dealing true damage but vel'koz isnt.

honestly looking at champion.gg says she's probably balanced to me.  She might have a massive pick rate but only people with a lot of games on her are succeeding, 125+.  This nerf seems pretty logical.

How's that?

If she's balanced then why nerf her?  Either the nerf would make no sense or vayne is OP.  It isn't logical to take a champion who is currently balanced and make them weaker.

yeah in hindsight what i said doesnt make much sense, but she did get a tower killing buff to compensate.  That was what i meant.  Loses damage to champions that she has in spades and gains damage to turrets seems fair to me.

The Q could always Crit, they just cleaning up the math behind it
and the R changes are likely being pulled

Where is Vayne boardline broken? Her late game isn't even very outclassing of others, and her early game is so terrible. Caitlyn, a lane bully, has similar late game to Vayne. (Paraphrased quote from the #2 Vayne in NA) Is there something wrong with buffing a bad champion?

Then again, I have seen people on this Boards call Kayle OP, so I'm not that surprised.

Vayne just does not fit well at all with the bot lane meta of either early game aggression ADCs (the Ghostblade users) or Ashe. Also, "enchantress" supports are not the best choice bot lane with Vayne since yeah they can enable her a little bit.....but enabling a wet noodle before level 6 still makes it a wet noodle.

"On the border of being broken"

I can't even remember the last time I've seen a Vayne. Let alone one that actually survived the laning phase.

Basically any other carry is way better than Vayne because their lane phase isn't shit tier and they still become godlike monsters late game

Final Hour (R) grants 25 range*
**[Manwolfaxeboss noted he is likely pulling this one. Not represented on tooltip.]**


Source: http://www.surrenderat20.net/p/current-pbe-balance-changes.html and https://twitter.com/ManWolfAxeBoss/status/753350708171198465

This means It's UNLIKELY to make it to live servers.
I mean we have worse things to deal with, Vayne won't be a problem. Not to mention all of her counters are meta.
Agreed, ANY buff to Vayne will make her perma ban at this point.
